feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 100 to 140 mm of rain with downpours 25 to 40 mm/h possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 120 to 150 mm of rain, especially about higher ground with localised downpours 25 to 40 mm/h possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 100 to 120 mm of rain. Peak rates of 25 to 40 mm/h expected late Wednesday morning and during the afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 140 to 180 mm of rain with localised downpours 25 to 40 mm/h possible, with largest accumulations likely west of Whakatane. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain and accumulations may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 70 to 110 mm of rain, especially in the east. Intensities of 10 to 20 mm per hour are possible, mainly during Wednesday morning. There is a slight chance of downpours with higher intensities. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 100 mm of rain, and possibly more in localised areas if downpours occur. Intensities of 10 to 20 mm per hour with possible downpours of 25 to 40 mm per hour in isolated locations. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Orange Warning extended to include all of Northland.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 40 to 60 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, with intensities of 15 to 20 mm/h possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 30 to 50 mm of rain near the Divide and up to 25 mm within 15 km east of the Divide. Intensities of 15 to 20 mm/h. Freezing level 3000 metres. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
